intro: Delissea chockii, commonly known as the Chock's delissea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
